greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers obtained by rotating right the indices in the prime signature of n.
comment: If n = p^a*q^b*r^c, then a(n) = p^c*q^a*r^b.
If n = p^a*q^b*r^c*s^d, then a(n) = p^d*q^a*r^b*s^c.
The sequence is a permutation of the positive integers. The first term which is different from A069799 is a(60).
Inverse permutation to A225891. The fixed points are A072774 (squarefree numbers and their powers). - _Ivan Neretin_, Jul 26 2015
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
results.author: _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_, Apr 08 2005
